thread.title: Okposo helps Islanders hand Sharks their 1st loss, 6-3
thread.title_full: Okposo helps Islanders hand Sharks their 1st loss, 6-3

title: Okposo helps Islanders hand Sharks their 1st loss, 6-3
text:
Updated: 10:38 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 | Posted: 10:38 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 Okposo helps Islanders hand Sharks their 1st loss, 6-3 Related View Larger San Jose Sharks goalie Alex Stalock (32) defends the net against a penalty shot by New York Islanders center Mikhail Grabovski (84) during the first period of an NHL hockey game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 in New York. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) View Larger New York Islanders goalie Jaroslav Halak (41) and defenseman Nick Leddy (2) defend the net against a shot by San Jose Sharks center Joe Thornton (19) during the first period of an NHL hockey game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 in New York. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) View Larger New York Islanders goalie Jaroslav Halak (41) reacts as San Jose Sharks right wing Joel Ward (42) celebrates with his teammates after scoring a goal during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 in New York. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) View Larger San Jose Sharks center Joe Pavelski (8) scores a goal past New York Islanders goalie Jaroslav Halak (41) and defenseman Nick Leddy (2) during the first period of an NHL hockey game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 in New York. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK — 
Kyle Okposo scored the tiebreaking goal early in the third period and added two assists as the New York Islanders beat San Jose 6-3 Saturday night, handing the Sharks their first loss of the season. 
Johnny Boychuk, Anders Lee, Josh Bailey, Brock Nelson and Frans Nielsen also scored to help the Islanders win their third straight — all at their new Brooklyn home. Jaroslav Halak made his season debut after missing the first four games due to an undisclosed upper body injury and finished with 22 saves. 
Joe Pavelski, Nikolay Goldobin and Joel Ward scored for San Jose, which opened the season 4-0-0. Alex Stalock stopped 28 shots. 
On the go-ahead goal, Okposo got the the rebound of his own shot behind the net, skated around Sharks defender Brenden Dillon and beat Stalock to put the Islanders up for good. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
